trial_identification.studytitle: Effects of pregnancy and childbirth on pelvic floor morphology and sexual function in Egyptian women
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Evaluation of levator ani muscle integrity in early postpartum period using three dimensional pelvic floor translabial ultrasound, in women after vaginal versus elective or urgent cesarean section, and study of its effects on sexual function in Egyptian women.

conditions.healthcondition: screening for postpartum female pelvic floor muscle "levator ani" affection.
screening for postpartum sexual function in Egyptian women.

interventions.interventions: 1- transperineal pelvic floor ultrasound applied for the submitted 120 women "primiparae" (40 women after normal vaginal delivery), (40 women after urgent cesarean section), (40 women after elective cesarean section), in early postpartum period (48 to 72) hours postpartum, to evaluate levator ani morphology, according to Edessy Pelvic floor Integrity Score (EPIS), This is a unique scoring system based on trans-perineal ultrasonographic evaluation of levator ani muscle morphology and biometric measures. This scoring system has 4 items (levator hiatus area LHA), (levator ani avulsion side), (levato urethral gap LUG), and (levator ani avulsion size), Score from 0 to= 3 considered severely malfunctioning female pelvic floor. Score from 4 to= 6 considered mildly malfunctioning female pelvic floor. Score > 6 up to 8 considered well-functioning female pelvic floor. 2- answering of the validated female sexual function index (F.S.F.I) three months postpartum period for same cases submitted to ultrasound.
interventions.comparator: transperineal pelvic floor ultrasound applied for the 40 women after elective cesarean section in early postpartum period (48 to 72) hours postpartum, to evaluate levator ani morphology. and answering of the validated female sexual function index (F.S.F.I) three months postpartum period for same cases submitted to ultrasound.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Pelvic floor muscle strength as assessed by three/four dimensional translabial pelvic floor ultrasound
primaryOutcome.timepoint: early postpartum period (48 to 72) hours postpartum

primaryOutcome.outcome: Sexual function of pelvic floor as assessed by the validated female sexual function index

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Trauma or avulsion of levator ani muscle as assessed by three/four dimensional translabial pelvic floor ultrasound
Sexual function as assessed by the validated female sexual function index

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: primiparae in early postpartum period (48 hours to72 hours). written consent was taken. easy communicable, reachable women for further requirements.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1. Refused consent. 2. Previous vaginal or cesarean delivery. 3. Severe mental illness. 4. Severe physical handicap or difficulties in communication. 5. Women without postpartum active sexual life or separate from their spouse. 6. Past history of sexual dysfunction.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 1 Al-mokhayam aldaem street, Nasr city, Cairo (PO:11823)

fundingsource.fundingaddress: 1 Al-mokhayam aldaem street, Nasr city, Cairo (PO:11471)

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To evaluate levator ani morphology following normal vaginal delivery and cesarean section (elective and emergent), using three-dimensional (3D) ultrasound, and to study the effect of mode of delivery on female sexual function.

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: 1 Al-mokhayam aldaem street, Nasr city, Cairo (PO:11471)
